Audio Description:
Encouraging a healthy home front through a balanced diet is the theme of this World War II poster. The background of the poster is yellow. In the upper left hand corner of the poster is a red box with white capital letters that read: “East the Basic 7 every day!”  In the center of the poster is a circular graph that contains the basic food groups as follows:   
Group one - green and yellow vegetables; Group two - oranges, tomatoes, grapefruit; Group three - potatoes and other vegetables and fruits; Group four - milk and milk products; Group five - meat, poultry, fish or eggs; Group six - bread, flour and cereals; and Group seven - butter and fortified margarine. Around the circle are seven cartoons that illustrate the benefits of a healthy diet that promotes good eyesight and strong bones as well as building muscles and fighting fatigue. At the bottom of the poster are white italicized capital letters on a gray strip that reads: “Eat a lunch that packs a punch!”
Creator: United States. Department of Agriculture. War Food Administration. Food Distribution Administration

Title: Eat the basic 7 every day!: eat a lunch that packs a punch!
